content.p: Tubular secretion has three main functions. Correctly answering the following questions will reveal the three functions of tubular secretion:

multiple_choice.choice: Removes substances that are otherwise difficult to filter out.
Returns filtered water and many filtered solutes to the bloodstream.

feedback.p: Correct. One of the three functions of tubular secretion is that it removes substances that are otherwise difficult to filter out.
Incorrect. The returning of filtered water and filtered solutes to the bloodstream is otherwise known as reabsorption.

body.p: What is a second function of tubular secretion?

multiple_choice.choice: Tubular secretion is the total amount of filtrate formed by the two million renal corpuscles.
Tubular secretion disposes of substances or end products that have mistakenly reabsorbed.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The total amount of filtrate formed by the two million renal corpuscles in the kidneys is a component of glomerular filtration rate (GFR)
Correct. One of the three functions of tubular secretion is that it disposes of substances or end products that have mistakenly reabsorbed.

multiple_choice.choice: Separates the inside of the glomerular capsule from the blood.

feedback.p: Correct. One of the three functions of tubular secretion is that it eliminates excess potassium ions.
Incorrect. The filtration membrane separates the inside of the glomerular capsule from the blood.
